Dear Dr* School^
We in Air Weather Service, at the present time, find our¬
selves in a rather peculiar position* Air Weather Service, which
is a highly technical division of the Air Force, is faced with the
fact that while our colleges are producing graduates with credits
in physics and mathematics, the graduates, at the present time,
show little interest in a technical career with Air Weather
Service*
We feel that this situation can be somewhat remedied through
proper education, indoctrination, and familiarization with our
mission* We believe that NAEB can be of great assistance in the
accomplishment of this mission*
Specifically, we are interested in knowing if NAEB would be
interested in carrying a 13-week series of educational programs
with reference' to meteorology and climatology* These would be
produced in Washington, D* C*, and broadcast during the months
of March, April, and May, 195&*
If you are interested and able to assist us, will you please
communicate with me as soon as possible and I will send you more
detailed information*
Thank you for your cooperation*
RICHARD L. SPEARS
2nd Lt., USAF
Office Information Services
